output:
There's some longings in my hands that make me feel so bad
I sometimes even want to cry
And there are feelings in my head that make me feel so sad
But my eyes are still dry
But I don't know why they won't come out
It's stuck inside, like in a prism you can't break out
I think I can accuse some people for it
But it's not a thing that will cure me
I need to make it differently
Pull all the pieces apart
And put them back together
To start anew
As my boys and my six-foot-old girl
I let the wind start to heal that fever on my heels
And I begin to feel more real
So I grab the wheel and let the roll roll like Neil
And I conceal my will of burning a bill
As ill as I was, I must have lost my skin
But I still sing and thrill
Till my wind of life breaks into you
